body:
Generated urls look like:
https://github.com/search?q=user%3Aagentender&l=R
instead of:
https://github.com/search?q=user%3Aagentender+lang%3AR
Just a silly grammar nit.

Thank you for this awesome project!

I noticed that my GitHub resume did not list repos to which I had push access. 
- My resume link - http://resume.github.io/?sudo-suhas
- Unlisted repos:
  - https://github.com/davidtheclark/cosmiconfig
  - https://github.com/booleanapp/elastic-muto

I checked the [relevant GitHub documentation](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/#list-user-repositories) and it has a query parameter to request all repos. This will include repos of which I am either 'owner' or 'member'.

This PR adds the query parameter to the API request. I was able to confirm the behavior with GET API requests:
- Default type - 'owner' - https://api.github.com/users/sudo-suhas/repos
- Type - 'all' - https://api.github.com/users/sudo-suhas/repos?type=all

I have not tested this locally but I am reasonably confident that this should work.

While attempting to play with this, I was unable to generate my own resume.

The issue is that private repositories appear to lack a description, which ends up breaking the resume generation [here](https://github.com/resume/resume.github.com/blob/master/js/githubresume.js#L422).

This fixes it.
The favicon icon is the same used across Github.
Just a regex replace, seems to work with @honzi's resume
Those users haven't opted in, it's meaningless to list on index, maybe can add some other people later.
Googlecode platform is going to close, so load html5shiv from CDNJS with https.
This is #218 rebased in one commit.

Previous link was broken.

e.g

https://github.com/languages/Rust (broken)
v.
https://github.com/trending?l=Rust
`https://resume.github.io` was previously blocked for me by Firefox's mixed content policy.

Changed the link for language in resume page from  www.github.com/languages/lang to en.wikipedia.org/wiki/lang_(programming_language).

That url wasn't working and wikipedia has consistent format of link for programming languages.
The description says watchers but gives the count for stars instead. Simple substitution, closes #208.
Since github serves it's stuff in https, we cannot load https. It would have been even better to include jquery locally too.

We must load scripts over HTTPS, otherwise browsers block us from
loading the scripts we ned to run if the site is loaded over HTTPS.

Fixes: #203
Closes: #202
Signed-off-by: Aleksa Sarai cyphar@cyphar.com
Loading the site using https didn't work, so I fixed it.
Hyphens are only ever to be used to hyphenate words – they are not punctuation.

Swapped out 'Usecases' with properly spaced 'Use Cases' for readability.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3825178/6122463/c540644c-b0a8-11e4-8b2e-67721cf710eb.png)

This PR force YUI and jQuery assets to be served from secure servers. The YUI files was bundled into the application just because Yahoo! doesn't provide a way to get this file from HTTPS, and jQuery now has a path that will use the current protocol in usage.
Loads reset-fonts-grids.css and jquery  over https if user is using https.

http://resume.github.io/ will be redirected to https://resume.github.io/ now, loading libraries via http will make no sense, and the browser will tell users that the page contains some insecure resources,
reference : [The Protocol-relative URL](http://www.paulirish.com/2010/the-protocol-relative-url/)
Need I say more?

Protocol-relative URLs are not an option because yui-s enforces HTTPS. HTTPS
resources on HTTP sites are fine anyways.
Previously, if there was an error with the API, for instance a request limit, it would show that the used hasn't opt-in. Now it shows the error page.
As described in #182, this change allows full HTTPS support.
Was previously leading to 404, I think pointing to the list of users repos using the targeted language makes sens.
for issue https://github.com/resume/resume.github.com/issues/155
Looking around the code I had to fix the mix of spaces and tabs and formatting :smile_cat: I also found a missing at view/index.html
Fixes the bug which stops this to load on anyone else's machine

- c5e49dd adds HTTP 403 handling for when a user's API limit has been reached. *#55
- e915614 adds HTTP 404 handling - as is mentioned in #61.
Since the wide majority of GitHub users provide something other than a blog in the place to provide a personal URL, I think it would make more sense to refer to it as a website, and not a blog :)

An [example](http://resume.github.io/?chocolateboy) where this isn't working:

> On GitHub since 2008, <empty string> is a developer with...

I believe this will fix the paging issue with checking to see if a user has starred the resume.github.com repo. (P.S. I contacted GitHub support about adding an API for unauthenticated checking star status of a single repo. They said they'll look into it but gave no time-frame promises.)

In the "GitHub Profile" section, it will display "$user is a developer with X public repositories. ..."

However, if the user in question only has other people's forks, it will display "I have no public repositories. Sorry". Two conflicting statements.

The section now states "All my repositories are forks" if that's the case. Perhaps that's not ideal, but I think it's better than what's there now.

You can test with my alter-ego, http://resume.github.io/?another-leprechaun

Thanks for creating the auto-resume, it's great!

I reworded a few lines to remove the use of they/their when referring to an individual (a non-royal individual).
It's now:

```
 On GitHub since last year, Maarten van Egmond is a developer with 4 public repositories.
```

or

```
 On GitHub as an early adopter since last year, Maarten van Egmond is a developer with 4 public repositories.
```

The blog line is it's own section.

Also I didn't know how to get the rack server up and running so after figuring it out I updated the README with that developer info.

Hope you find the changes useful!

```
 Maarten
```
Moved comma inside and full stop to outside the `{{#blog}}{{/blog}}`.
Opt out kpu.
Thanks.
Implemented an opt-in strategy based on a users starring of the resume/resume.github.com project. It uses the `users/:user/starred` api, which pulls down a user's list of starred projects.
Please and thank you.
for the record I'm on the "opt-in" team.

Thanks, I'd prefer an opt-in implementation, but at least this would help.  I didn't realize there was even a way to opt out until I saw comments about https://github.com/resume/resume.github.com/pull/118 on Twitter.

This is the simplest thing I could see working for a basic serverless opt.in strategy.
I would just transfer ownership of this repo to you or you could create an empty repo and change the name.
https://github.com/nisbus/resume.github.com.opt.in

BTW sorry for the indentation, Emacs insisted to keep it like this :).

Cheers,
   nisbus
remove rlivsey
Opting out.

In the absence of a formal way to set our profiles to private for this kind of activity we can (should?) adopt a community standard. I recommend we use a `.optout` repo.

This pull request adds support in **resume** to check a user's repo list for a `.optout` repo. If the repo is present the user is considered `opted_out`. With this change people won't have to fork this project and add their name to a list and we will, potentially, have a solution that works for similar applications/mashups/etc.

This is a proposed solution for adding opt-in functionality. In much the same way as the opt-out solution, this is pretty annoying.

The major difference is that it allows users to give consent. It's clear that many people don't want their resume to be generated by this app. Whatever their reason, it's not their responsibility to inform the maintainers of this app of their lack of consent after the harm has been done.

With the current code Github founders are not considered early adopters. See: resume.github.io/?mojombo

He joined Github in 2007 which is before february 2008, the current threshold.

My github data is public information, but it is presented on resume.github.io in a way that looks too official and personal for my tastes. The resume generated is neither, so I would like to opt out.

This implementation makes it easy for others to opt out, just add them to the array.

Since [introduction of the "Contributions" tab](https://github.com/blog/1360-introducing-contributions) we don't get repositories list unless changing tab on users profile.

Therefore I update repositories list's link to immediately access to this content
fixing tab/space problem in code. removed tabs. chose to use space because it was used through all the document. now it should be correctly aligned when viewing on github (and everywhere else).

In order to fix https://github.com/resume/resume.github.com/issues/64.
I created a temporary app for resume.github.com and used the credentials on ajax calls, in attempting to fix rate-limit requests.

I did some code following the issue https://github.com/resume/resume.github.com/issues/16.

Not sure why it doesn't show the logo of org.

> This repository has 4 watchers and 0 fork.

In English zero should be plural: 0 forks
Fixed: Triple braces prevented the processing of user tag. Corrected capitalization for GitHub.
Fixed: Triple braces prevented the processing of user tag. Corrected capitalization for GitHub.

The language on the gh-pages branch blames the github user you're attempting to view on $(window).error - the language in the master branch is much better. This just updates the gh-pages branch to match the master.

The existing library breaks IE10 since the shim layer for jQuery 1.5 is
pretty cold and has significantly changed to be a lot better. I moved to
the jquery CDN since Google's CDN is really flaky and the 1.8.1 is
retuning error pages on that CDN.

Fixes #40
If you would like more information about this organization, please visit `github.com/organization_name`
Just a minor formatting tweak: Github => GitHub

Changed the error page to redirect the visitor to the user's profile page inline with Brian Zeligson's suggestion from http://beezee.github.com/Development/2012/09/02/please-stop-breaking-my-github-profile/.

Hi,

I added the config.ru for development and thought others may like it.

I think the background image (from subtlepatterns.com) makes the page a little easier on the eyes.

I thought a print button might be nice, and the print.css was already there. Added an email link too.

- Add missing `?callback=?` to calls to `$.getJSON` to turn them into
  JSONP calls to avoid same-origin lockdown.
- Move from `.forEach` to `$.each` to work around intermittent breakage
  with `.forEach`.

API V2 has been shut off since 1st June 2012. I also took the time to
remove github.js since we weren't using much of it.

Fixes #35

### Summary

We replace lines such as

> This repository has 1 watcher(s) and 5 fork(s).

with

> This repository has 1 watcher and 5 forks.

![mojombo](http://i.imgur.com/qUnMv.png)

As mentioned by @amstan and @n1k0 in #3, I think "Passionate Github user" should'nt be used for all users. And I tried to do more than hide this text on inactive users' résumé.

Firstly I only defined this status depending on repositories count. Then I worked on a more advanced algorithm with those parameters :
- Number of repositories
- Public gists count
- Followers
- Following
- and few other elements (extra points)

Feel free to adapt status, values and all this algorithm :)
A new CSS here to enhance display when printing résumé.

This pull request contains 2 commits to fix 2 differents issues :
#9 - "display the total number of followers" (one of @deanc's suggestions)
#11 - "when a users' email is private, an extra dash remains in the footer" (by @tlvince)
I liked both parts of @dmoney's suggestion (#7).  I think the changes make the resumes look cleaner and more informative.
A tiny grammatical error no one will ever see, but worth correcting anyway.
Make the "My Popular Repositories" be built from your complete list of repositories.  Must have at least one contribution to be counted.
